Class DatabaseManager

extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the local and remote databases.

      • open

        public static void open()
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Opens the database connection, creating it if it does not exist. Does not register JDBC driver.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - could not get driver connection, or change autocommit parameter.

      • open

        public static void open(boolean initialize)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Opens the database connection, creating it if it does not exist.
        Parameters:
        initialize - registers the JDBC driver, for initial loading on some machines.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - could not register driver, or could not open database.

      • close

        public static void close()
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Closes the database connection. Called after a set of actions are performed so the database is freed for use elsewhere without conflict.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Could not commit transactions, or close the connection to the database.

      • inUse

        public static boolean inUse()

      • isDatabaseConnected

        public static boolean isDatabaseConnected()
        Checks to see if the database is currently connected.
        Returns:
        true if the database is connected.

      • deleteDatabase

        public static void deleteDatabase()
        Deletes database, and all records. Primarily used for cleaning up after test cases.

      • populateDatabaseWithDefaultValues

        public static void populateDatabaseWithDefaultValues(java.lang.String username)
        Populates the database with default data from .csv files.
        Parameters:
        username - username of the user to which the data should be associated to

        public static void addRecord(DataPoint point,
                             java.lang.String username,
                             java.lang.String listName)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds a single record to the database. The type of the record is identified and is stored in its respective table.
        Parameters:
        point - A point to be added to the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when record cannot be added.

        Parameters:
        points - ArrayList of points to be added.
        username - Username the points are to be associated with.

        java.sql.SQLException

      • updatePoint

        public static void updatePoint(java.lang.String username,
                               java.lang.String listName,
                               DataPoint oldPoint,
                               DataPoint newPoint)
        Updates a point with new values
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the owner of the point
        listName - Name of the list the point exists in
        oldPoint - Point to be updated
        newPoint - New values to be included in database

      • deletePoint

        public static void deletePoint(java.lang.String username,
                               java.lang.String listName,
                               DataPoint point)
        Deletes a point from the database
        Parameters:
        username - Owner of the list to delete the point from
        listName - Name of the list to delete the point from
        point - Point to delete
